description: To fell One Flowering Cherry (T1 on map) at T23 within TPO 109
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.

The medium sized Cherry tree is located in the front garden of the property. It is multi-stemmed and in a fair condition, giving it a moderate amenity value. It can be seen by all road users, neighbours and path users.

The tree is in good health with minor structural defects. It is likely to have a long term future in its current location and can be seen by many people in the immediate area. Looking at its form, long term future and the volume of people that can see the tree we have assessed that it has a moderate amenity value to the local area.
This application is refused as we view the tree to have a longer future that described within the application and therefore the specification of work is too severe.
